page.title: 12FARMING - HOLBERROW GREEN
page.content:
This predominantly farming area produces a variety of crops, wheat, barley and oats for example. Grass is cut and dried and provides hay as winter feed for cattle, silage is also made.
Amongst the animals kept are dairy cattle and Hereford cross Friesians which are bought at a week old and sold after 18 months for the beef market. The ewes kept are changed every 3 years, or so and the home produced lambs are sold as fat lambs in summer. Sometimes one lamb is kept by the farmer to stock the family freezer.
The popular markets for buying and selling of animals are Stratford upon Avon and Kidderminster, the latter being the main place to buy cattle.
